result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance D Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to submit DNA sample. If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

defendant.name: Mueller, Lance D

records.addlTxt: 2:06 PM Defendant Lance D Mueller appeared by video from New Lisbon  Correctional. Attorney Michael Yang appeared by video for Lance D Mueller.  Attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin. Right to in person court hearing recited, Defendant waived right to in person court hearing, Rights/ elements, Defendant pleads no contest to count 1. Court finds Defendant guilty. Judgment to be entered. Court dismissed the repeater. Court sentences defendant to 30 months prison consecutive to any other sentence with 18 month initial confinement and 12 months extended supervision, $518.00 cost/ fines, DNA sample. Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program. 2:21 PM
filed by Atty Yang

2:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Lance D Mueller appeared by video, in custody at New Lisbon Correctional. Attorney Michael Yang appeared by video for Lance D Mueller. Defendant waived his right to be personally present in courtroom. Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued. 2:03 PM
